TEXT.TITLE: WEST GERMANY RESCHEDULES SIERRA LEONE DEBT
TEXT.BODY: West Germany and Sierra Leone signed an agreement to reschedule 26 mln marks of principal and interest payments on loans, the West German Foreign Ministry said. A statement said the agreement related to interest and principle and obligations from previous reschedulings due between July 1, 1986 and November 13, 1987 as well as arrears from the period up to June 30, 1986. The statement said the payments were rescheduled for 1992 to 1996 under the accord, which followed a multilateral rescheduling pact agreed by "Paris Club" creditor nations on November 19, 1986.
